messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: making friends while unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Try the national Home education network:   - look under support/support group listings. -pam
messages.messageBody:
Try the national Home education network: <www.nhen.org> - look under
support/support group listings.

-pam

On Mar 15, 2005, at 11:42 AM, soggyboysmom wrote:

>> I just joined a NH homeschooling list yesterday, but it looks like
>> a very
>> quiet list. All the homeschooling groups I am finding (on Yahoo)
>> seem to be
>> associated with some church or other, and I am not exactly a
>> church-goer.
>> Is there a better place to look for one?
>>
>> Judy
> have you looked anywhere besides Yahoo? Try simply searching on NH
> homeschool and see what you find.

messages.subject: Re: making friends while unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... have you looked anywhere besides Yahoo? Try simply searching on NH homeschool and see what you find.
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Judy Anderson"
<temair@a...> wrote:
> I just joined a NH homeschooling list yesterday, but it looks like
>a very
> quiet list. All the homeschooling groups I am finding (on Yahoo)
>seem to be
> associated with some church or other, and I am not exactly a
>church-goer.
> Is there a better place to look for one?
>
> Judy
have you looked anywhere besides Yahoo? Try simply searching on NH
homeschool and see what you find.

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] making friends while unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I just joined a NH homeschooling list yesterday, but it looks like a very quiet list.  All the homeschooling groups I am finding (on Yahoo) seem to be
messages.messageBody:
I just joined a NH homeschooling list yesterday, but it looks like a very
quiet list. All the homeschooling groups I am finding (on Yahoo) seem to be
associated with some church or other, and I am not exactly a church-goer.
Is there a better place to look for one?

Judy
-----Original Message-----
From: Earthmomma67@... [mailto:Earthmomma67@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 15, 2005 1:00 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] making friends while unschooling



What state are you in? Have you checked out any local homeschool groups?
My
kids have never lacked for friends since leaving school because we became
very
involvd in local activities.
Elissa
Mystik Hill Farm
Kearneysville, WV

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] making friends while unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/15/2005 11:47:45 AM Eastern Standard Time, unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes: My daughter mostly enjoys going to kindergarten.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/15/2005 11:47:45 AM Eastern Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:
My daughter mostly enjoys going to kindergarten. Before kindergarten she
had no friends. I am a bit of a homebody and we don't have neighbors, just
businesses all aroud us. I have always wanted to homeschool.
What state are you in? Have you checked out any local homeschool groups? My
kids have never lacked for friends since leaving school because we became very
involvd in local activities.
Elissa
Mystik Hill Farm
Kearneysville, WV


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
